With the idea of developing the bishop before playing ...Ne7.  However without any specific objective the bishop might as well stay on f8.
moves.7. h4 Be4 8. Rh3 h6 9. a3 Be7: loses a couple of tempi.  If Black is not going to play ...Bxc3, what is the point of 6... Bb4.
moves.18. Bc4 f5: White has a strong position and Fritz recommends 19 Nf2.
moves.19. Bxe6: I decide to give up my knight for two pawns, giving me a mobile pawn center.   Fritz considers this a major blunder, since I am not only giving up material but Black will have the initiative for awhile.   My feeling is that Black's initiative will eventually dissipate and then my mobile pawn center will make it's power felt.   This is all beyond the machine's horizon and illustrates the difference in how humans view things as opposed to computers.
This is where Ion has suggested White could improve.   Perhaps 22. c4 Ne7 23 Qe4.
moves.22... Ne7 23. Qc2 Ned5 24. Bd2 Qd7 25. f: Fritz believes that Black has an edge.
moves.32... g6: ?? The losing move according to Fritz.  Here Fritz suggests 32... Nc8 when Fritz believes that Black would have an edge.   I disagree and believe that White still has better chances after 32...Nc8.
moves.33. d6: Black is now overrun by the White pawn center.

gameName: The Worth of a Pawn Chain
